hanzi-su-wiki:
橋

Значения

Мост

Мнемоника

  • Высоченное 喬 деревянное 木 сооружение — мост.

  • "Это деревянные 木 мост и здание."

Варианты

桥, 槗

purpleculture_info:
(Simplified: 桥)
Pictophonetic: 喬 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
purpleculture_examples:
橋梁 [ qiáo liáng ]: bridge (lit. and fig.)
橋牌 [ qiáo pái ]: contract bridge (card game)
purpleculture_tree:
• ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 喬 [ qiáo ] tall, lofty; proud, stately
heisig_chinese_memo: When I used to pretend that tree logs were massive bridges..
heisig_constituent: bridge, tree, wood, angel, heavens, mouth, hood, mouth, mouth2
heisig_story: The bridge shown here is made of trees in their natural form, except that the trunks have been carved into the forms of angels, a sort of "Ponte degli Angeli."
koohiiStory1: The nicest bridge is not in Hollywood or Los Angeles, but in San Francisco.
koohiiStory2: A small 5 year old child has lost her mother in a tragic death. Her family tells her, "Don´t worry, your mom is an angel now, in heaven, watching over you." The small girl takes this very literally and is found one day, gathering pieces of wood. Her dad asks her, "What are you doing with that wood?" "I´m trying to build a bridge to heaven to visit the angels.".
jp_example_words:
桟橋(さんきょう): wharf, bridge, jetty, pier
橋渡し(はしわたし): bridge building, mediation
鉄橋(てっきょう): railway bridge, iron bridge
橋(はし): bridge
WaniKani_Radicals: 木, 天, 口, 冋
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: A tree from heaven with a mustache above his mouth valiantly crosses a bridge. This holy tree from heaven was sent down to earth to cross this very bridge. It is the tree’s angelic mission. Also the tree has a mouth and a mustache.
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Picture this majestic tree as it crosses the bridge. Its mustache is very distinguished. Hear its roots and branches swaying, creaking, and cracking in the wind.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The tree finishes crossing the bridge and on the other side is a plate of steaming hash (はし) browns! That's why it has a mouth. To eat yummy bridge hash browns.
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Imagine sitting on the bridge with the tree and eating hash browns with it. It's heavenly!
Ru_Notes: Фонетик: 喬 (たかい、キョウ высокий). Не путать: 稿 (したがき、コウ рукопись, черновик).
Ru_Radicals: ノ, 冂 (перевёрнутая коробка), 口 (рот), 木 (дерево)
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the lofty (喬) tree (木) becomes a bridge
chinese_mnemonics_deck__story: When I used to pretend that tree logs were massive bridges.
humanum_full_description_en:
From the sound of " wood " to " Qiao ", the original meaning is a bridge, that is, a building erected on water or in the air for passage. "Shuowen": "Water beams. Congmu, Qiaosheng." "Mozi·Beichengmen": "The broken city is pierced by slabs, and evils pass through the outside, followed by slabs." , Frame the city moat for communication."

" Bridge " can mean a beam on an object. "Yi Li-Shi Hun Li": "The 笲缁 is lied and added to the bridge." Zheng Xuan's note: "The bridge, so the 纪笲."

" Bridge " also means the name of a certain tree. "Shang Shu Da Chuan-Catalpa": "The Yang of Nanshan has a wooden bridge, and the Yin of Nanshan has a wooden catalpa."
humanum_short_description_en: From the sound of " wood " and " Qiao ", the original meaning is a bridge, that is, a building erected on water or in the air for passage.
humanum_full_description:
從「木」，「喬」聲，本義為橋梁，即架在水上或空中以便通行的建築物。《說文》：「水梁也。从木，喬聲。」《墨子‧備城門》：「斷城以板橋，邪穿外，以板次之。」孫詒讓閒詁：「連板為橋，架之城塹，以便往來。」

　　「橋」可表示器物上的橫梁。《儀禮‧士昏禮》：「笲緇被纁裏，加于橋。」鄭玄注：「橋，所以庪笲。」

　　「橋」還表示某種樹木之名。《尚書大傳‧梓材》：「南山之陽有木名橋，南山之陰有木名梓。」
humanum_short_description: 從「木」，「喬」聲，本義為橋梁，即架在水上或空中以便通行的建築物。

Chinese Definition:
Pictophonetic: 喬 indicates the sound; 木 (wood) conveys the meaning.
  • ⿰ Left to right
    • 木 [ mù ] tree; wood, lumber; wooden
    • 喬 [ qiáo ] tall, lofty; proud, stately
①架在水上或空中便於通行的建築物：橋樑。橋墩。橋涵。橋頭堡。吊橋。棧橋。引橋。立交橋。
②形狀如橋樑的：心臟搭橋手術。
③古同“喬”，高。
④古同“矯”，正，整。
⑤姓氏。
橋梁 [ qiáo liáng ]: bridge (lit. and fig.)
橋牌 [ qiáo pái ]: contract bridge (card game)

從「 木 」，「 喬 」聲，本義為橋梁，即架在水上或空中以便通行的建築物。《說文》：「水梁也。从木，喬聲。」《墨子‧備城門》：「斷城以板橋，邪穿外，以板次之。」孫詒讓閒詁：「連板為橋，架之城塹，以便往來。」 「 橋 」可表示器物上的橫梁。《儀禮‧士昏禮》：「笲緇被纁裏，加于橋。」鄭玄注：「橋，所以庪笲。」 「 橋 」還表示某種樹木之名。《尚書大傳‧梓材》：「南山之陽有木名橋，南山之陰有木名梓。」
From the sound of " wood" to " Qiao", the original meaning is a bridge, that is, a building erected on water or in the air for passage. "Shuowen": "Water beams. Congmu, Qiaosheng." "Mozi·Beichengmen": "The broken city is pierced by slabs, and evils pass through the outside, followed by slabs." , Frame the city moat for communication." " Bridge" can mean a beam on an object. "Yi Li-Shi Hun Li": "The 笲缁 is lied and added to the bridge." Zheng Xuan's note: "The bridge, so the 纪笲." " Bridge" also means the name of a certain tree. "Shang Shu Da Chuan-Catalpa": "The Yang of Nanshan has a wooden bridge, and the Yin of Nanshan has a wooden catalpa."

橋字的基本解释

橋
qiáo
见“桥”。

橋字的汉语字典释义

[①]［qiáo］
［《廣韻》巨嬌切，平宵，羣。］
亦作“槗1”。“桥1”的繁体字。
(1)桥梁。架在水上或空中以便通行的建筑物。
(2)架桥。
(3)器物上的横梁。
(4)指如桥之物。
(5)木名。
(6)通“喬”。高。
(7)通“槁”。干枯。参见“橋死”。
(8)古国名。
(9)姓。春秋鲁有桥庇。见《汉书·儒林传序》。
[②]［jiāo］
［《集韻》居妖切，平宵，見。］
“桥2”的繁体字。
(1)桔槔。井上汲水工具。或指桔槔上的衡木。
(2)通“憍”。骄傲。参见“橋2泄”。
[③]［jiǎo］
［《集韻》舉夭切，上小，見。］
“桥3”的繁体字。
(1)山行用具。《史记·河渠书》：“﹝禹﹞陸行載車，水行載舟，泥行蹈毳，山行即橋。”裴駰集解引徐广曰：“橋，近遥反。一作'檋'。檋，直轅車也。”一说即轿。
(2)通“矯”。矫正。
(3)通“矯”。伪，虚假。参见“橋3言”。
(4)通“撟”。翘起；伸出。
(5)劲疾。

橋字的康熙字典解释

【辰集中】【木字部】　橋； 康熙笔画：16； 页码：页553第01
【唐韻】巨嬌切【集韻】【韻會】渠嬌切【正韻】祁堯切，?音喬。【說文】水梁也。从木喬聲。喬高而曲也。橋之爲言趫也，矯然也。【史記·秦本紀】昭王五十年，初作河橋。　又懸繩以度曰絚橋。【水經注】罽賔之境，絚橋相引。　又器之有橫樑者曰橋。【儀禮·士昏禮】笲加于橋。【註】橋以庋笲。　又桔橰上衡也。【淮南子·主術訓】橋直植立而不動，俯仰取制焉。　又橋泄，嫚也。【荀子·榮辱篇】橋泄者，人之殃也。　又戾也。【呂覽·離謂篇】聽言而不可知，其與橋言無擇。　又木名。【尚書大傳】橋木高而仰，梓木晉而俯，以喩父子。　又陽橋。【春秋】魯地。　又姓。【統譜】黃帝葬橋山，子孫守塚，因爲氏。【史記·貨殖傳】橋姚致馬千匹，牛倍之。　又【集韻】丘妖切，音蹺。【史記·河渠書】山行乗橋。【註】橋，一作?，直轅車也。　又【集韻】居勞切，音高。勁疾貌。【莊子·則陽篇】欲惡去就，於是橋起。　又【韻會】渠廟切，音嶠。【禮·曲禮】奉席如橋衡。【疏】左低右昂，如橋之衡。　又屈橋，壯健貌。【揚雄·河東

Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［qiáo］
["Guang Yun" Ju Jiao cut, flat night, group. ]
Also known as "槗1". Traditional characters for "桥1".
(1) Bridge. A building erected on the water or in the air for traffic.
(2) Bridge.
(3) The beam on the utensil.
(4) Refers to something like a bridge.
(5) Wooden names.
(6) Through "Joe". high.
(7) Through "槁". Withered. See "Bridge Dead".
(8) Ancient country name.
(9) Last name. Lu has a bridge shelter in the Spring and Autumn Period. See "Han Shu · Preface to the Biography of Rulin".
[②]［jiāo］
["Ji Yun" live in the demon cut, flat night, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "桥2".
(1) Tangerine. Water draw tool from the well. Or refers to the Hengmu on the orange.
(2) Through "struck". proud. See "Bridge 2 Leakage".
[③] [jiǎo]
["Ji Yun" Ju Yao cut, Shang Xiao, see you. ]
Traditional characters for "桥3".
(1) Mountain hiking equipment. "Historical Records · River Canal Book": "﹝Yu﹞ travels on land to carry vehicles, water travels to carry boats, mud travels through the mud, and mountains and bridges." . 檋, straight-wheel car also. "Said it is the sedan.
(2) Through "correction". Correction.
(3) Through "correction". False, false. See "3 Bridges".
(4) Through "挢". Cocked; stretched out.
(5) Sickness.

Radicals: 木, 天, 口, 冋  (tree, heaven, mouth, mustache)
Meaning Mnemonic
A tree from heaven with a mustache above his mouth valiantly crosses a bridge. This holy tree from heaven was sent down to earth to cross this very bridge. It is the tree’s angelic mission. Also the tree has a mouth and a mustache.
Picture this majestic tree as it crosses the bridge. Its mustache is very distinguished. Hear its roots and branches swaying, creaking, and cracking in the wind.
Reading Mnemonic
The tree finishes crossing the bridge and on the other side is a plate of steaming hash (はし) browns! That's why it has a mouth. To eat yummy bridge hash browns.
Imagine sitting on the bridge with the tree and eating hash browns with it. It's heavenly!
